intro: Agrimonia eupatoria var. humilis, commonly known as lesser agrimony, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in loose umbels, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have toothed margins. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
